sm::eod::GazeOutputData

GazeOutputData Class Reference

#include <gazeoutputdata.h>

Inherits EngineOutputBase.

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Data class that represents gaze related data output by the Tracking Engine.

const fStdVector3& eyeballCentre ( int  eye_id  )  const

Positions of the eye balls in world coordinates.

The positions of the centre of the eye balls in world coordinates. If the system is not using IR-based gaze, these are derived from the calibrated, or if not available, from the uncalibrated eye ball positions relative to the head model features. If the system is able to track IR-gaze, a more accurate value is logged If the system is in search mode, the value is 0.

Parameters:
eye_id Specifies which eyeball centre is returned (sm::eod::RIGHT_EYE or sm::eod::LEFT_EYE)
Exceptions:
std::invalid_argument if eye_id is neither LEFT_EYE nor RIGHT_EYE

bool gazeCalibrated (  )  const

Flag indicating whether or not gaze has been calibrated.

Calibrated gaze is more accurate than uncalibrated gaze.

GazeQualityLevel gazeQualityLevel ( int  eye_id  )  const

Quality of gaze output for a given eye.

This is a value between 0 and 4 which indicates how accurate the gaze direction is. The gaze quality levels are: 0: No Gaze Available - No gaze direction value could be measured 1: Head-Pose Gaze - The gaze direction is the same as the head-direction 2: Non-IR Gaze - Gaze direction calculated when Infra-Red data is not available This is the gaze quality that was produced by faceLAB 3 and earlier 3: IR Gaze - Gaze direction estimated using IR data

Parameters:
eye_id Specifies which eye the Gaze Quality Level is for (sm::eod::RIGHT_EYE or sm::eod::LEFT_EYE)
Exceptions:
std::invalid_argument if eye_id is neither LEFT_EYE nor RIGHT_EYE

static const std::string& gazeQualityLevelName ( GazeQualityLevel  gql  )  [static]

Precondition:
gql must be in the range NO_TRACKING..NUM_GAZE_QUALITY_LEVELS-1

const fStdVector2& gazeRotation ( int  eye_id  )  const

Gaze direction in world coordinate space around [x,y].

The orientation of the eye gaze with respect to the world coordinate system is encoded in these fields. The values are the Euler angles in radians for rotations around the x- and y-axis to align the z-axes of the world coordinate system with the eye gaze direction. The eye gaze direction defined in this way represents the direction of a vector originating from the eyeball centre. If the system is in search mode, the values are 0. These values are filtered with the internal faceLAB saccade filter.

Parameters:
eye_id Specifies which gaze direction is returned (sm::eod::RIGHT_EYE or sm::eod::LEFT_EYE)
Exceptions:
std::invalid_argument if eye_id is neither LEFT_EYE nor RIGHT_EYE

bool saccade (  )  const

Flag indicating a saccade.

The flag is set during saccades of the eye gaze as detected by the internal faceLAB saccade filter. This signal is the basis for the eye gaze filter.

void setEyeballCentre ( int  eye_id,
const fStdVector3 &  eyeball_centre 
)

Set the position of the eyeball centre for a given eye.

Parameters:
eye_id The eye to set the eyeball centre for
eyeball_centre vector of length 3 ([x, y, z]) representing the 3D position of the eyeball centre (in world coordinates)
Precondition:
eye_id is either LEFT_EYE or RIGHT_EYE

eyeball_centre is a 3D point
